intro: Oncoba dentata, commonly known as the American holly, is a deciduous tree native to the eastern United States. It is characterized by its spiny, elliptical leaves with toothed margins and red berries that persist through winter. The plant is part of the family Cornaceae and is known for its ornamental value in landscaping. Its bark is smooth and gray, becoming fissured with age, and it can grow up to 30 meters tall. Oncoba dentata is also valued for its ability to thrive in a variety of soil types and its role in supporting local wildlife.
